places_with_reviews.name: Sarangpur Hanuman Mandir, Ahmedabad
places_with_reviews.address: 2JG2+G3V, Kalupur Rd, Suodagarpole, Laxmi Bazar, Khadia, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380001, India

reviews.text: Excellent Lord Hanuman temple with best infrastructure & facility at the temple area. Stay at White House is very good with neat & clean rooms. There is a big tall Lord Hanuman Murty near White House. Prayer gives peace of mind & positive wibes.

जय श्री राम
जय हनुमान
Must visit temple of Hanuman dada.
Accomodation facility is good, as well very large area parking for vehicles.
Very vast campus. Very neat and clean also. Prasadam very satvik. Take home Prasad packing sukhdi , in packing of 25₹, 50₹ , 100 ₹.
Excellent mandir with big lord Hanuman status  here and it's very famous place. If you want to stay here it has very nice and clean rooms and other facilities. It's a very popular temple.

Shree Kashtabhanjan Dev Hanumanji Temple is a renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, located in the village of Sarangpur, Botad district, Gujarat, India. It is one of the most prominent temples of Hanumanji in the region, revered for its unique idol and miraculous stories associated with it.

The Idol of Kashtabhanjan Dev:

The temple enshrines the idol of Hanumanji in the form of Kashtabhanjan Dev, meaning "crusher of sorrows." The idol is depicted standing tall, holding a mace in one hand and a mountain (representing Lanka) in the other. This form signifies Hanumanji's power to vanquish all troubles and anxieties of his devotees.

History and Significance:

The temple belongs to the Vadtal Gadi of the Swaminarayan Sampradaya. The idol was installed by Gopalanand Swami, a close disciple of Swaminarayan, in 1856. According to legend, when the idol was touched with a rod during the installation ceremony, it miraculously came alive and moved. This event cemented the temple's reputation as a site of divine blessings and miracles.

Healing Rituals and Practices:

Devotees visit the temple seeking relief from various ailments and misfortunes. A unique ritual called "panch dava" is performed here, where five holy substances are applied to the idol and then offered to devotees. This ritual is believed to possess immense healing powers and bring solace to troubled minds.

Other Attractions:

The temple complex also houses a gaushala (cow shelter), a dharamshala (guest house) for pilgrims, and a serene garden. Devotees can participate in daily prayers, attend religious discourses, and immerse themselves in the spiritual atmosphere of the temple.

Visiting the Temple:

The Sarangpur Hanumanji Temple is easily accessible by road from major cities like Ahmedabad and Surat. It is open throughout the day, with special pujas and ceremonies held on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

If you are planning a visit to Gujarat, make sure to include the Shree Kashtabhanjan Dev Hanumanji Temple in your itinerary. It is a truly magnificent and spiritually uplifting place that is sure to leave a lasting impression.

The Sarangpur Hanumanji mandir is must visit palce for devotees in Gujarat. This temple holds great historical significance. There are numerous temples that you can visit, and the temple area are large and lovely. There is excellent parking available. Although a bit pricey, the canteen's food is generally excellent.

places_with_reviews.name: ISKCON Temple, Ahmedabad
places_with_reviews.address: Satellite Road, Sarkhej - Gandhinagar Hwy, Bodakdev, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380015, India

reviews.text:
Visiting the ISKCON Temple in Ahmedabad was a serene and spiritually uplifting experience. The temple's architecture is breathtaking, and the atmosphere is peaceful. The temple complex is well-maintained and clean, providing a sense of tranquility amidst the bustling city.

The temple's sanctum is a sight to behold, with beautiful idols of Radha and Krishna. The devotional music and chanting add to the spiritual ambiance, making it a perfect place for meditation and prayer.

The temple also offers delicious vegetarian food at its restaurant, which is a must-try for visitors. Overall, the ISKCON Temple in Ahmedabad is a must-visit for anyone seeking spiritual solace and a glimpse into Indian culture and traditions.

ISKCON Temple in Ahmedabad is a magnificent spiritual landmark known for its stunning architecture, serene atmosphere, and vibrant cultural activities. Dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha, it offers a peaceful sanctuary for meditation and reflection. The temple hosts various events and festivals throughout the year and features a vegetarian restaurant and a gift shop. Whether you're seeking spiritual solace or cultural enrichment, a visit to ISKCON Temple Ahmedabad promises a memorable experience.

Chant the Hare Krishna mantra and immerse yourself in the peaceful vibes of the ISKCON temple.

Surrender to Lord Krishna's divine love and experience eternal bliss at the ISKCON temple.

Such this place is a heaven. ❤️🫶🏻✨🙇

ISKCON Temple in Ahmedabad is a lovely spot. It's peaceful and calming, perfect for prayer or quiet reflection. The temple itself is stunning, and there are often events going on. Whether you're looking for a spiritual experience or just want to take in the sights, it's worth a visit.

Captivated by the ethereal beauty and profound spirituality of ISKCON Ahmedabad, my journey transcended mere sightseeing to a soul-stirring experience. With each step, I felt drawn deeper into a realm where time seemed to stand still, and the air resonated with the echoes of ancient chants. Surrounded by majestic architecture and the serene ambiance, I couldn't help but marvel at the palpable sense of peace that enveloped every corner. Truly, ISKCON Ahmedabad is more than a mere monument; it's a sacred haven where one can embark on a journey of inner exploration and spiritual discovery.

places_with_reviews.name: Law Garden
places_with_reviews.address: Netaji Rd, Maharashtra Society, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380009, India

reviews.text: It's a good plenteous place to hang out with your own self or also with a bunch of peeps. One can really find and feel nature's love there also there is no chaos only one can hear birds chirping. Places like this are much needed in the crowded areas.

It's a really great place to find peace and calmness. A very big garden in fact with lots of trees and surroundings with green lawns everywhere,when you visit the place you will definitely get answers to many questions also the timings are great so you can visit at night also.Must visit place if you are in Ahmedabad

It's a fantastic city spot for everyone. Kids love the playgrounds, while young and old enjoy the calm atmosphere. There are good toilets available. Paid parking is also available.

Next to the park, there's a great traditional market for shopping. You'll find an amazing variety of food stalls and restaurants around the park for delicious meals.

The garden is very good and well maintained. It is well lit for night walks too. The market next to the garden is only for women and you have to be careful from pickpocketing. It mostly sells traditional Gujarati clothes and imitation jewellery. There are some good food stalls in the street. It is well connected by city BRT bus service as law garden is the station.

Law Garden in Ahmedabad is a must-visit destination, especially on a Sunday morning. The vibrant atmosphere, filled with colorful handicrafts, delicious street food, and friendly locals, makes it an unforgettable experience. Don't miss out on the opportunity to immerse yourself in Gujarat's rich culture and connect with the heart of the community at Law Garden. Highly recommended!

places_with_reviews.name: Sabarmati Ashram
places_with_reviews.address: Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Ashram Rd, Hridaya Kunj, Old Wadaj, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380027, India

reviews.text: The ashram offers a serene and well-preserved environment, showcasing pivotal moments from Gandhi's life that effectively capture his contributions and personality. It's not just a historical site but also an excellent space for personal reflection. The calm and cleanliness, coupled with the natural beauty of the river and trees, create a tranquil atmosphere. The Gandhi museum within the ashram is a treasure trove of historical movements, documented through compelling photos and illustrations, making it a universally enjoyable experience regardless of one's ideology or religion. A visit provides both a historical insight and a peaceful retreat.

There is no entry fee for the ashram and parking is also available for free. The ashram is well maintained and really clean. One can easily spend over an hour in the ashram.
The whole life of Gandhi and his ideology is well explained in the ashram. The view of Sabarmati river from the ashram is beautiful.
Drinking water and clean washrooms are available within the ashram premise. There are also many books related to Gandhi that one can find in the ashram library and the book shop.

Peaceful getaway amidst the city. The museum is quite beautiful and informative. Ell maintained, clean and quite cool because of the greenery

The best spot is the riverfront promenade which is secluded, less crowded and peaceful . You can spend hours here.

Best thing, its for free!

Good:
- Serene and peaceful ambiance, perfect for meditation and reflection.
- Well-maintained grounds with lush gardens and scenic views of the Sabarmati River.
- Informative museum with exhibits detailing Mahatma Gandhi's life and the history of India's independence movement.
- Knowledgeable guides who provide insightful tours and share interesting anecdotes.
- Opportunity to see Gandhi's living quarters and the simple lifestyle he led.
- Regular cultural programs and events that promote Gandhian principles and Indian culture.
- Clean and well-kept facilities, including restrooms and drinking water facilities.

Bad:
- Limited parking space, which can be challenging during peak hours or events.
- Some areas may be crowded, especially on weekends or holidays.
- The museum and ashram grounds can get hot during the summer months, so visiting early in the morning or late in the evening is recommended.
- Accessibility for elderly or disabled visitors may be limited in certain areas.

Overall, Sabarmati Ashram is a must-visit destination for anyone interested in Indian history, culture, and the legacy of Mahatma Gandhi.

Very clean  and well maintained place with free entry. If you are interested to know about Gandhi it will provide you good info, they have good collection from that era with real structures. Also it's on the shore of sabarmati river so good view from the place

places_with_reviews.name: Science City Ahmedabad

reviews.text:
You need a full day to enjoy each and every place in Science city ! Wear comfortable shoes because you have to walk around! Different packages are available according to your interest you can choose from the packages !
Best package according to me is of 349/person and it has 8 places to visit ! That too requires full day !
The bestest part is aquatic gallery and robotic world which takes you to future advancements ! A very nice place according to all aspects ! Worth the price ! Good for every age group from a child to a old aged person !

We had experienced only the Aquarium but it was worth going .my 2.5 year old enjoyed it a lot..
Do plan in advance by reviewing the map and things to do from their website..it will help to decide which ticket to buy..

Well maintained and well planned..

Spectacular Revival of Science City's Musical Fountain

I recently had the pleasure of experiencing the reopened musical fountain attraction at Science City, and let me tell you, it was nothing short of mesmerizing! The addition of fire, laser, and water effects elevated the entire experience to a whole new level of entertainment and story telling

The coordination between the music and the visual effects was impeccable, creating a symphony of sights and sounds that captivated everyone in the audience. The combination of fire, laser beams, and dancing water choreography added an element of excitement and wonder that left me in awe throughout the entire show.

Kudos to the team behind this spectacular revival - you've truly outdone yourselves!

I visited Science City when i was in Ahmedabad. There is nothing much in Nature and Energy park to see. But the Aquatic galley is purely astounding. They have collection of all kinds of fish with beautifully made aquatic life scenery and well maintained. And added to that Shark tunnel is top-notch it will make us think like we are part of the Aquarium. It is one of the best place to visit in Ahmedabad.

Good place for kids. However lots of walking is required. Ample parking for vehicle is available. Ticket can be purchased on site. Different food courts are also available. A good tour of this requires full day.

places_with_reviews.name: Riverfront Flower Park
places_with_reviews.address: Riverfront Rd, Ellisbridge, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380006, India

reviews.text: I visited this place with my friends. the ticket was 40 rupees (this includes the atal bridge too). This place is full of colourful flowers and plants. There was next to no rush in the garden. There are plenty of places to take pictures and to just sit and chill. There is a big lake too. Overall the place was very beautiful and quiet. I visited this place in the afternoon so I could not see the lighting. The restroom was at the end of the garden. Must visit this place. If anyone is coming here I will surely suggest going here in the evening and enjoy the lighting around the place.

my admiration for the exceptional flower show organized recently. The captivating display of diverse international flowers truly made the event a delightful experience for attendees of all ages.

The meticulous arrangement of flowers showcased a vibrant palette of colors and an exquisite variety of blooms. It was evident that a great deal of effort and creativity went into curating such a visually stunning exhibit. The inclusion of different international flowers added a unique and fascinating touch to the overall display.

I particularly want to commend the organizers for creating an environment that not only appealed to adults but also provided an educational and enjoyable experience for children. The diverse selection of flowers surely captured the imagination of young minds, fostering a love for nature and appreciation for global floral diversity.

the atmosphere was filled with joy and fascination as visitors explored the enchanting world of flowers.

Experience is really mesmerizing.
Entry fee is 50/ for the west side and for the East side it is 90/.
There are so many varieties of flowers.
Eatery shops were also there.
Drinking water and a washroom facility is also available.
Try to visit during evening hours for better view.
Nursery is also there to buy plants.
Free parking facility is available.

Amazing flower show organized by government. Unique designs. Must visit. Lighting decoration as well. Entry fees on weekends is high for public. It's 50 on weekdays n 75 on weekends. It is remaining very crowded and will take 2 hours at least to complete the entire show.

The Riverfront Flower Park offers a serene and beautiful setting for nature lovers and flower enthusiasts alike. With its well-maintained pathways, vibrant flower beds, and scenic views of the river, it provides a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Strolling through the park allows visitors to immerse themselves in the colors and fragrances of various flowers and plants, making it a perfect spot for relaxation and photography. The park's proximity to the river adds to its charm, creating a peaceful atmosphere conducive to quiet contemplation. Overall, the Riverfront Flower Park is a delightful destination for anyone seeking a rejuvenating experience surrounded by nature's beauty.

places_with_reviews.name: Sabarmati Riverfront
places_with_reviews.address: 2HFG+9MJ, Sabarmati Riverfront Walkway E, Old City, Lal Darwaja, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380001, India

reviews.text: The riverfront is nice but the accessibility is a bit hectic. If an old person wants to visit the place there are no amenities one has to walk a long distance. There is a facility of using bikes. But what's the point if one has to return the same place after the ride.it would have been better if the bike points have a linkage from one to others . There's a boat rides too which follows the same facility as bikes.Overall its nice place to visit but when one has spent so much on the development of waterfront. Its better to overlook the accessibility in the development too.

Very nice Place to visit With Friends and Family.  the Ahmedabad Flower Show has become one more unique attraction of the city people look for. This annual event was started in 2013 with an aim to make people aware of horticulture, nature, and environment. Citizens are educated on the subjects like how to do roof top gardening, prepare garden in office, net house, kitchen gardening etc. Must visit the 2024 New Year celebration.
Best place in Ahmedabad to sit alone or with your family and friends. Looking at the Sabarmati river are different and cute feelings...! You can rent a bicycle here .

The Sabarmati Riverfront, a splendid 11km concrete promenade, offers a captivating view of the Sabarmati River. Its daytime ambiance is a harmonious blend of Brutalist and Modernist architecture, punctuated by the verdant greenery of Neem trees, adding a touch of nature to the urban landscape.

During weekdays, the Riverfront is typically less crowded, making it an ideal spot for tranquil walks or leisure activities. The weekends attract more visitors, yet the expansive space ensures there's room for everyone. With no entry fee, it serves as a perfect weekend retreat for families.

The Riverfront stretches across various localities, some of which may not be safe at certain times. Therefore, if you plan to explore the entire length of the Riverfront, either on foot or by bicycle, it's advisable to do so in the company of others.

The atmosphere here is positively vibrant, particularly during winter mornings. It's a sight to behold as the cityscape is bathed in the warm glow of the rising sun. I highly recommend a visit to the Sabarmati Riverfront for anyone seeking to experience this beautiful spectacle.

Best public hangout spot in Ahmedabad!

Unfortunately, the country's infrastructure is moving in a way, where malls have become hangout spots and gardens and green covers are diminishing. Its good to see riverfront breaking the trend and offering something different :)

I've been in multiple cities of the country, but the riverfront is unparalleled for what it has to offer.

The scenic night view of Ahmedabad from Sabarmati is magnificent.

A cool run by the banks of Sabarmati in early hours of morning is refreshing.

I can't wait to see how beautifully it evolves once the GIFT City extension gets connected to the main one

places_with_reviews.name: Delhi Darwaja
places_with_reviews.address: 2HQQ+458, Mirzapur Rd, Old City, Halim Ni Khadki, Shahpur, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380004, India

reviews.text:
Delhi Darwaja, nestled in the heart of Ahmedabad, is a fascinating glimpse into the city's rich history and culture. As the old city, it proudly stands as a testament to Ahmedabad's architectural legacy. The market at Delhi Darwaja is a bustling hub for wholesale dealers, with a special charm during seasonal markets. Among these, the kite markets during the vibrant Uttrayan festival add an extra layer of excitement.

The historical significance of Delhi Darwaja is enhanced by its splendid old architecture. The place exudes a timeless charm that captivates visitors. However, the charm extends beyond its historic value. Daily life at Delhi Darwaja is a bustling spectacle with a constant influx of people, creating a lively atmosphere.

While the vibrancy is invigorating, it is important to note the challenges presented by the heavy footfall. The rush of the public, combined with various modes of transportation like AMTS, BRTS, and rickshaws, can result in substantial traffic. At times, the absence of traffic police officers poses challenges, leading to instances of rule-breaking by some individuals. It is suggested that enhanced traffic management measures be considered during peak hours to ensure a smoother experience for both locals and visitors.

In summary, Delhi Darwaja is an iconic destination, steeped in history, and a must-visit for those seeking a taste of Ahmedabad's cultural tapestry. The energetic vibe, coupled with its historical significance, makes it a unique and memorable experience.

This place has historical significance and is due to its locality. Delhi door is a get-away towards seasonal and essential marketplace. although it is a crowded place where the number of vehicles can create a massive blockage of traffic as the land is very narrow in width.

Delhi darwaja is the one of the most antique gate of four gates of ahmedabad which was arrange by the king of ahmed. It is situated near the dariyapur it is called dilli chakala near it's a brt stop is available many people are come four tour
A Historical Dilli Darwaja boldly narrates the history of the City's ancient glory and stands tall till date.

Lal Darwaja, located in Ahmedabad, India, holds significant historical and cultural importance. The name "Lal Darwaja" translates to "Red Gate" in English, referencing the prominent red-colored gate that once stood at this entrance to the walled city of Ahmedabad during the Mughal era.

This area bustles with activity, serving as a vibrant commercial hub where locals and tourists alike flock to explore its bustling markets, narrow alleys, and historical landmarks. The marketplaces near Lal Darwaja offer a diverse array of goods, from traditional textiles, jewelry, and handicrafts to spices, street food, and household items.

Beyond its commercial significance, Lal Darwaja is steeped in history. It stands as a symbol of the city's rich heritage, having witnessed the ebb and flow of centuries of trade, culture, and architecture. The surrounding buildings showcase a blend of Mughal, British colonial, and traditional Gujarati architectural styles, reflecting the city's multicultural past.

Moreover, Lal Darwaja is a testament to Ahmedabad's resilience and adaptability. Despite undergoing modernization and urban development, it has retained its charm and essence, attracting visitors seeking an authentic glimpse into the city's soul.

The area around Lal Darwaja also hosts various cultural events, festivals, and religious gatherings, further adding to its dynamic atmosphere. Visitors can immerse themselves in the sights, sounds, and flavors of Ahmedabad, experiencing the city's vibrant energy firsthand.

In essence, Lal Darwaja stands as more than just a gateway; it serves as a living embodiment of Ahmedabad's storied past, bustling present, and promising future.
